result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:27 AM Defendant Aaron J Gray in court.  Attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski in court for Aaron J Gray.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called to address the doctor's report.  
Both counsel have received and reviewed the report.
Attorney John Marten appeared on behalf of Waukesha County.
Court accepts the findings in the doctor's report.
Court finds defendant not competent and not likely to regain competency within the statutory time frame.
Court orders the criminal proceedings be suspended and the defendant discharged from the criminal competency.
Court orders the defendant be released from custody.
Court orders the defendant be taken into custody forthwith and promptly delivered to Waukesha Mental Health Center or other appropriate treatment facility designated by Wis. Stats. 51.15(2)(d).

Neither party objects to the findings in the report.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
09:21 AM Defendant Aaron J Gray in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to review doctor's report filed 5/31/22.
Both counsel have received and reviewed the report.
Court reads the findings into the record.
State does not contest the findings. 
Statements by Attorney Ostrowski.  Attorney Ostrowski advises the defendant may request different counsel and may be contesting the findings in the doctor's report.
Statements by the defendant.  Defendant does not request different counsel.
Court will have Attorney Ostrowski remain on the case at this time.
Defendant does not challenge the findings in the doctor's report.
Court adopts the findings in the doctor's report and finds the defendant incompetent.  Court orders the defendant committed for treatment to competency.
Defense advises the defendant has 56 days of credit.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Dr. Katelyn Grusecki.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 5/9/22
Review hearing on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:33 AM Defendant Aaron J Gray in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to review the doctor's report filed 5/5/22.
Defendant is objecting to the request for an inpatient exam and would like to continue pro se.
State agrees with the doctor's recommendation for an inpatient exam.
Court orders defendant to be transferred to the facility for an inpatient exam.
Court will address the defendant's request to proceed pro se at the next hearing.  Attorney Ostrowski to remain on the case at this time.  Review hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski
Review hearing on May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Competency

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses/Burlington Coat Factory listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:13 PM Defendant Aaron J Gray in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Defendant will supply address and cell phone number to his attorney.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  Review hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
